1.title: Precursor to chords: Intervals
1.point: Intervals refer to the distance between two notes; This distance affects how the two notes sound together. Intervals are said to be made of a number of half and/or whole steps

2.title: Chords
2.point: Chords are combinations of three (or four) notes with specific intervals between each note, which create a certain signature sound. Chords are created from a combination of two different intervals: Minor Thirds and Major Thirds
2.subtopic1: A minor third consists of 3 half steps
2.subtopic2: A major third consists of 4 half steps

3.title: Chords (Cont.)
3.point: There are four different types of chords: Major, Minor, Augmented, Diminished. We will mostly cover major & minor chords today
3.subtopic1: Major chords are created from a major chord (in green), followed by a minor chord (in purple)
3.subtopic2: Minor Chords are created from a minor chord (in purple), followed by a major chord (in green)
